data.event: The creek was named in 1858 after Alice Olinda Hodgkinson, the daughter of Clement Hodgkinson, Victoria's acting Surveyor General.

event.title: was made available for horticulture in the early 1900s

data.event: The town was initially a logging settlement, however as land was made available for horticulture in the early 1900s, the town began to grow substantially.
The Post Office opened on 21 August 1901.

event.title: 1919 the Australian artist Sir Arthur Streeton returned

data.event: In 1919 the Australian artist Sir Arthur Streeton returned to Australia and built a house on the property called Longacres, in Olinda.
